Czesław Koepke

Professor of physics, UMK
Faculty of Physics, Astronomy and Informatics

About me

I am a physicist, my field of interest is solid state spectroscopy, laser physics and photonics. Currently I am involved in some activity on search for novel laser media based on transition metal or rare earths ions. Below you will find my CV and publication list, and information on my grants, our Lab and my didactics.

Born:


1952, Chełmno, Poland

Specializations:


Solid State Physics
Solid State Spectroscopy

Education:


  • 1976

    Nicholas Copernicus University, Institute of Physics – MSc

  • 1983

    PhD

  • 1988-91

    Boston University – Postdoctoral Fellowship

  • 1994

    Dr.hab

Hobbies:


music, jazz, architecture, modern art and modern literature.

Employment:


  • 1976-79: Nicholas Copernicus University, Institute of Physics – Postgraduate Student
  • 1979: Member of technical staff
  • 1982: Assistant Lecturer
  • 1984: Lecturer, Adjunct
  • 1988-91: Boston University, Chemistry Department – Research Associate
  • 1994: Nicholas Copernicus University – Senior Lecturer, Dr. hab.
  • 1995-2006: Vice-Director of the Institute of Physics
  • 1999: Extraordinary Professor
  • 2006: Professor
  • 2009: Ordinary Professor

Activities:


Physics of the lasers, optical nonlinearities in semiconductors, solid state spectroscopy, photonics, excited-state spectroscopy. First observations and interpretations of the excited state absorption in d0 molecular complexes in solids, discovery and interpretation of the excited-state photochromism in solids (bismuth germanate). Observation and interpretation of the excited-state absorption characteristics in various glasses, glass ceramics and crystals doped with transition metal (mostly chromium of various valence states) and rare earth (e.g. holmium, neodymium, praseodymium) ions. Observation and interpretation of various anti-Stokes and upconversion emissions in rare earth – activated glasses, glass ceramics and crystals.

Selected papers:


  • Nonlinearities and Bistability in Semiconductors
    Acta Phys. Polon. A 75, 219 (1989), Cz. Koepke
  • Electronic Photochromism: Case Study of Bismuth Germanate
    J. Luminescence 47, 227 (1991), Cz. Koepke, A. Lempicki
  • Excited-State Absorption in Excimer-Pumped CaWO4 Crystals
    J. Luminescence, 54, 345 (1993), Cz. Koepke, A.J. Wojtowicz, and A. Lempicki
  • Study of Closed-Shell Molecular Complexes as Possible Laser Media
    IEEE J. Quant. Electronics, QE-31, 1554 (1995), Cz. Koepke, A.J. Wojtowicz, and A. Lempicki
  • Excited State Absorption in Cr3+-Doped Gahnite Glass Ceramics
    J. Luminescence, 78, 135 (1998), Cz. Koepke, K. Wiśniewski, M. Grinberg, D.L. Russell, K. Holliday, and G.H. Beall
  • Optical spectroscopy and multiple-line gain in Pr3+- activated fluoroaluminate glass
    J. Phys.: Condens. Matter 14, 6785 (2002), Cz. Koepke, K. Wisniewski, and M. Naftaly
  • Excited state spectroscopy of the silica sol-gel glass activated by Cr5+ and Cr6+ ions
    J. Phys.: Condens. Matter 14, 11553 (2002), Cz. Koepke, K. Wisniewski, M. Grinberg and F. Rozploch
  • Upconverted luminescence under 800 nm laser diode excitation In Nd3+- activated fluoroaluminate glass
    Opt. Mater. 28, 129 (2006), Cz. Koepke, K. Wisniewski, L. Sikorski, D. Piatkowski, K. Kowalska and M. Naftaly
  • Excited state absorption spectroscopy of ZBLAN:Ho3+ glass - experiment and simulation
    J. Phys.: Cond. Matter 20 (2008) 155201, D. Piątkowski, K. Wiśniewski, M. Różański, Cz. Koepke, M. Kaczkan, M. Klimczak, R. Piramidowicz, M. Malinowski
  • Broadband (~ 300 nm) optical gain in the ZAS (ZrO2-Al2O3-SiO2) glass activated by chromium
    Opt. Mater. 31 (2009) 537, Cz. Koepke, K. Wiśniewski, D. Piątkowski
  • Competition between two types of anti-Stokes emission in Ho3+- activated ZBLAN glass
    J. Phys.: Cond. Matter 21 (2009) 035113, Cz. Koepke, K. Wiśniewski, D. Piątkowski, M. Malinowski
  • Nonmonotonic saturation characteristic and excited state absorption in long optical fiber
    Appl Phys B 103 (2011) 123, P. Stremplewski, C. Koepke, D. Piatkowski, M. Rozanski
  • ASE noise independent small signal modal gain measurements and mode imaging in double clad Nd3+- doped fiber around 900 nm
    Optics Express 22 (2014) 24847, P. Stremplewski, Cz. Koepke
  • Up-converted emission and mode beating in Er3+- doped fibers
    Optics Express 23 (2015) 28288-28299, P. Stremplewski, Cz. Koepke
Total number of papers: >70.
